articles.title: Thousands of farmers stage anti-tax protest in Argentine capital
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, April 23 (Reuters) - Thousands of Argentine farmers protested in Buenos Aires on Saturday against President Alberto Fernandez, whose policies to contain food prices to curb rampant inflation have been criticized by the agricultural sector.Argentina is one of the world's top food exporters and the sector is key to Latin America's third-largest economy.Protesters

articles.title: Russia's standing in G-20 not threatened by Ukraine invasion
articles.description: President Joe Biden has called for Russia to be kicked out of the group, but the U.S. has not said whether Biden would boycott the gathering if Russia participates.The G-20 members are Argentina, Australia, Brazil, Britain, Canada, China, France, Germany, India, Indonesia, Italy, Japan, Mexico, Russia, Saudi Arabia, South Africa, South Korea, Turkey, the U.S. and the EU.
articles.content: The last time Russia invaded Ukraine, in 2014, outraged world leaders booted Russia out of the Group of Eight industrialised nations, which quickly rebranded itself the Group of Seven. Eight years later, the G-7 is still holding at seven — a collecti... [6105 chars]

articles.title: Argentina will not modify $45 billion debt deal with IMF, finance minister says
articles.description: Argentine economy minister Martin Guzman said late on Friday that a $45 billion debt deal with the International Monetary Fund will not be modified, following a meeting with IMF head Kristalina Georgieva.

articles.title: Argentina Appeal Decision to Replay World Cup Qualifier vs Brazil
articles.description: FIFA had asked Brazil and Argentina to replay their cancelled World Cup qualifier due to a breach of Covid-19 quarantine rules
articles.content:
The Argentine Football Association (AFA) will appeal what it says is FIFA’s decision to force Brazil and Argentina to replay their World Cup qualifier, which was cancelled after five minutes due to a breach of COVID-19 quarantine rules.
An official w... [2082 chars]

articles.title: Soccer-Argentina appeal decision to replay World Cup qualifier
articles.description: The Argentine Football Association (AFA) will appeal what it says is FIFA's decision to force Brazil and Argentina to replay their World Cup qualifier, which was cancelled after five minutes due to a breach of COVID-19 quarantine rules. An official with the association said Argentina would take their appeal to the Court of Arbitration for Sport.
articles.content:

articles.title: World's top soyoil exporter says record prices a mixed blessing
articles.description: By Maximilian HeathBUENOS AIRES, April 22 (Reuters) - Argentina, the world's top exporter of soyoil, is unlikely to be able to take full advantage of record prices, exporters and analysts said, due to drought hitting the soy crop, a recent export tax hike and subsidies to keep domestic prices low.Soybean oil prices soared to a record high on Friday after Indonesia effectively
